title: DSAC sites

Places where DSAC has worked.

properties.name: Ash Springs
properties.description: Posted by WetlanderdDSAC trip: Several trips to Ash Springs with Doug and Steve and Tom Cummins. Home of Crenichthys baileyi baileyi, the White River Springfish "It\'s going to be raining here in about 15 minutes" - Dale Weber

properties.name: Crystal Springs
properties.description: Posted by Wetlanderdalamo nvCrystal Springs, home of endenic, endangered Crenichthys baileyi grandis, Hiko White River Springfish. Several DSAC trips have focused here and Ash Springs just to the south.

properties.name: DSAC Survey
properties.description: Posted by WetlanderdBeaver Dam Wash State ParkDSAC survey trip. The trip from hell!

properties.name: Devils Hole
properties.description: Posted by WetlanderdDevils holeDevils Hole: Death Valley National Monument Home of endangered Devils Hole pupfish

properties.name: Hot Creek
properties.description: Posted by WetlanderdDSAC: first trip in 1992 with Jim Heinrich. Dale Weber organized our first real work trip to Hot Creek, home of Crenichthys baileyi thermophilus, to remove non-native bass which were predating on the natives.

properties.name: Hot Creek Campground
properties.description: Posted by Wetlanderd Campsite where we camped during the first DSAC trip. Site of the first "Smoking Man".

properties.description: Posted by CrschmidtHot spring, temperature: 90 degress F, 32 degress C

properties.name: Lockes Big Spring, Hay Corral Spring, NV
properties.description: Posted by CrschmidtHot spring, temperature: 100 degress F, 38 degress C

properties.name: Meadow Valley Wash
properties.description: Posted by WetlanderdDSAC Survey March 2006Site of DSAC survey on Saturday March 18, 2006. Busted by Union Pacific for putting coins on the RR tracks. Found Celestite in fill rocks for roadbed.

properties.name: Moapa National Wildlife Refuge
properties.description: Posted by Wetlanderd Warm SpringsHome of Crenicthys baileyi moapa and Moapa dace. Former Howard Hughes ranch and resort. Dsac work party Spring 2005.
